info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 14 at 2:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN KENTON, NORTHERN CAMPBELL, NORTHERN BOONE AND SOUTH CENTRAL HAMILTON COUNTIES THROUGH 315 PM EDT... At 215 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Villa Hills. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds gusts up to 35 mph, pea size hail, frequent cloud-to-ground lightning, and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Lightning can cause serious injury or death. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Covington, Florence, Independence, Erlanger, Fort Thomas, Newport, Edgewood, Elsmere, Fort Mitchell, Villa Hills, Highland Heights, Taylor Mill, Bellevue, Fort Wright, Dayton, Ludlow, Southgate, Crescent Springs and Crestview Hills. This includes the following Interstates... I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 3. I-75 in Kentucky between mile markers 178 and 191. I-75 in Ohio between mile markers 0 and 3. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...35 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. When thunder roars, go indoors! Do not stay in the open or seek shelter under trees when lightning threatens. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
